title: Iran executes two men in public over deadly armed robbery
content: Shigeru Ishiba, recently elected as the leader of Japan's Liberal Democratic Party, intends to call a parliamentary election on Oct. 27 after assuming the role of prime minister. He focuses on reinforcing national security and continuing economic policies while tackling issues like declining birthrate. Key defense experts are anticipated in his Cabinet.
summary: Shigeru Ishiba, recently elected as the leader of Japan's Liberal Democratic Party, intends to call a parliamentary election on Oct. 27 after assuming the role of prime minister. He focuses on reinforcing national security and continuing economic policies while tackling issues like declining birthrate. Key defense experts are anticipated in his Cabinet.

title: EU to continue China electric vehicle talks even after final vote, say sources
content: The European Commission intends to keep negotiating with China over electric vehicle tariffs even after EU nations vote on final import duties this Friday. Proposed tariffs range from 7.8 per cent to 35.3 per cent, depending on company cooperation, and would be in addition to the standard 10% car import duty.
summary: The European Commission intends to keep negotiating with China over electric vehicle tariffs even after EU nations vote on final import duties this Friday. Proposed tariffs range from 7.8 per cent to 35.3 per cent, depending on company cooperation, and would be in addition to the standard 10% car import duty.

title: 'To hold general election on October 27': Japan's next PM Shigeru Ishiba
content: Shigeru Ishiba, poised to be Japan's next prime minister, intends to call a parliamentary election on October 27 after his formal election. Chosen as the leader of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party last Friday, he succeeds Fumio Kishida. With the LDP holding a majority in parliament, Ishiba's election is certain.
summary: Shigeru Ishiba, poised to be Japan's next prime minister, intends to call a parliamentary election on October 27 after his formal election. Chosen as the leader of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party last Friday, he succeeds Fumio Kishida. With the LDP holding a majority in parliament, Ishiba's election is certain.

title: Hassan Nasrallah to Nabil Kaouk: 7 Hezbollah commanders killed in Israeli strikes in 7 days
content: Israel has significantly escalated its actions against Hezbollah by killing seven top commanders, including leader Hassan Nasrallah. This move follows Hezbollah's alliance with Hamas in Gaza. The deaths present a major challenge for the organization. The group's Shura Council is expected to meet soon to select new leadership.
summary: Israel has significantly escalated its actions against Hezbollah by killing seven top commanders, including leader Hassan Nasrallah. This move follows Hezbollah's alliance with Hamas in Gaza. The deaths present a major challenge for the organization. The group's Shura Council is expected to meet soon to select new leadership.

title: 'My crowds are pretty big': Kamala Harris mocks Trump during fundraiser
content: Kamala Harris targeted Donald Trump at a fundraiser, boasting about her campaign's large crowds and addressing immigration in key states like Arizona and Nevada. She dismissed Trump's criticisms while gaining support from some Republicans. Harris also promised to eliminate federal taxes on tips for service workers, emphasizing the close race to the White House.
summary: Kamala Harris targeted Donald Trump at a fundraiser, boasting about her campaign's large crowds and addressing immigration in key states like Arizona and Nevada. She dismissed Trump's criticisms while gaining support from some Republicans. Harris also promised to eliminate federal taxes on tips for service workers, emphasizing the close race to the White House.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs taken 'off suicide watch' as court trial looms
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs is no longer under intensive monitoring at Brooklyn's detention center where he faces sexual assault and prostitution charges. Despite being denied bail twice, including a $50 million offer, Combs remains focused on his legal defense. His family has surrendered their passports to support his claim of not being a flight risk.
summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs is no longer under intensive monitoring at Brooklyn's detention center where he faces sexual assault and prostitution charges. Despite being denied bail twice, including a $50 million offer, Combs remains focused on his legal defense. His family has surrendered their passports to support his claim of not being a flight risk.

title: Melania Trump reveals her son Barron Trump's living situation in college
content: Melania Trump shared that her son Barron is residing at the family's Trump Tower home while attending New York University. She respects his decision to live in New York and hopes he enjoys his college experience. Barron, a recent Oxbridge Academy graduate, is enrolled at NYU's Stern School of Business.
summary: Melania Trump shared that her son Barron is residing at the family's Trump Tower home while attending New York University. She respects his decision to live in New York and hopes he enjoys his college experience. Barron, a recent Oxbridge Academy graduate, is enrolled at NYU's Stern School of Business.

title: Could an all-out war in the Middle East be avoided? What Biden said
content: US President Joe Biden has urged for efforts to prevent an all-out war in the Middle East amid rising tensions between Israel and Hezbollah. Following Israeli airstrikes that killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah, Biden expressed worries about potential involvement from Iran and the US. He plans to communicate with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu soon.
summary: US President Joe Biden has urged for efforts to prevent an all-out war in the Middle East amid rising tensions between Israel and Hezbollah. Following Israeli airstrikes that killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah, Biden expressed worries about potential involvement from Iran and the US. He plans to communicate with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu soon.

Israel's Netanyahu adds rival to Cabinet, strengthens hold on office
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has expanded his coalition by appointing former rival Gideon Saar to his Cabinet as a minister without portfolio. Saar will also serve in the Security Cabinet. This strategic appointment aims to fortify Netanyahu's position amid significant political challenges, including budget passage and military draft issues, while reducing ultranationalist influence.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has expanded his coalition by appointing former rival Gideon Saar to his Cabinet as a minister without portfolio. Saar will also serve in the Security Cabinet. This strategic appointment aims to fortify Netanyahu's position amid significant political challenges, including budget passage and military draft issues, while reducing ultranationalist influence.

title: US President Biden to visit Hurricane Helene-affected areas amid ongoing recovery efforts
content: President Joe Biden plans to visit areas hit by Hurricane Helene, ensuring it won't disrupt rescue efforts. He assured state officials of continued federal support as the storm's death toll reaches at least 84 across several states. Former President Donald Trump will also visit Georgia for damage assessment and relief distribution.
summary: President Joe Biden plans to visit areas hit by Hurricane Helene, ensuring it won't disrupt rescue efforts. He assured state officials of continued federal support as the storm's death toll reaches at least 84 across several states. Former President Donald Trump will also visit Georgia for damage assessment and relief distribution.

title: War intensifies in Middle East as Israel hit Beirut city for first time, also struck Houthis in Yemen
content: An Israeli airstrike targeted an apartment building in Beirut, killing at least two people and heightening regional tensions. This incident follows recent strikes on Hezbollah and Houthi positions. Over 1,000 Lebanese have died recently, with a million displaced. The US is advocating for diplomatic resolutions to avoid further conflict.
summary: An Israeli airstrike targeted an apartment building in Beirut, killing at least two people and heightening regional tensions. This incident follows recent strikes on Hezbollah and Houthi positions. Over 1,000 Lebanese have died recently, with a million displaced. The US is advocating for diplomatic resolutions to avoid further conflict.

title: Nasa astronauts receive new ride home as SpaceX Dragon capsule arrives at ISS
content: Two astronauts stuck on the ISS since June finally got their return transport through a SpaceX capsule after NASA deemed Boeing's Starliner unsafe due to thruster failures and helium leaks. The Dragon capsule will remain docked until February, while NASA continues inspecting the Starliner.
summary: Two astronauts stuck on the ISS since June finally got their return transport through a SpaceX capsule after NASA deemed Boeing's Starliner unsafe due to thruster failures and helium leaks. The Dragon capsule will remain docked until February, while NASA continues inspecting the Starliner.

title: US couple charged after allegedly attempting to sell baby for $1,000 and six-pack of beer
content: An American couple from Arkansas has been arrested for allegedly attempting to sell their two-month-old baby at a campground for $1,000 and a six-pack of beer. The child was found in poor condition and is now under the care of the Arkansas Department of Human Services. The couple faces felony charges.
summary: An American couple from Arkansas has been arrested for allegedly attempting to sell their two-month-old baby at a campground for $1,000 and a six-pack of beer. The child was found in poor condition and is now under the care of the Arkansas Department of Human Services. The couple faces felony charges.

title: Zookeeper mauled to death by lion in Nigeria after leaving protective gate open
content: Babaji Daule, a zookeeper at the Presidential Library Wildlife Park in Abeokuta, Nigeria, was killed by a lion after leaving the protective gate open during feeding. Authorities intervened and shot the lion to prevent further harm. This marks the second fatal lion attack on a Nigerian zookeeper within a year, raising safety concerns.
summary: Babaji Daule, a zookeeper at the Presidential Library Wildlife Park in Abeokuta, Nigeria, was killed by a lion after leaving the protective gate open during feeding. Authorities intervened and shot the lion to prevent further harm. This marks the second fatal lion attack on a Nigerian zookeeper within a year, raising safety concerns.

title: 'We really have to avoid it': Biden urges avoidance of all-out war as Israel-Hezbollah tensions escalate
content: US President Joe Biden highlighted the necessity of preventing an all-out war in the Middle East amid rising tensions between Israel and Hezbollah. Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon resulted in significant casualties, including Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death. The White House supports a 21-day temporary cease-fire proposed by multiple nations during the recent UN General Assembly.
summary: US President Joe Biden highlighted the necessity of preventing an all-out war in the Middle East amid rising tensions between Israel and Hezbollah. Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon resulted in significant casualties, including Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's death. The White House supports a 21-day temporary cease-fire proposed by multiple nations during the recent UN General Assembly.

title: 'Please don't do...': British priest issues a warning to Americans
content: Calvin Robinson, a British Anglican catholic priest and conservative commentator, advises Americans to avoid cultural missteps observed in the UK. He criticizes the UK government's handling of recent riots and expresses concern over the Church of England's liberal shift, which he believes weakens traditional Christian values. Robinson urges Americans to maintain their cultural identity.
summary: Calvin Robinson, a British Anglican catholic priest and conservative commentator, advises Americans to avoid cultural missteps observed in the UK. He criticizes the UK government's handling of recent riots and expresses concern over the Church of England's liberal shift, which he believes weakens traditional Christian values. Robinson urges Americans to maintain their cultural identity.

title: Nepal's monsoon floods toll reaches 170 as Kathmandu struggles to recover
content: Floods in Nepal's capital have left at least 170 dead and thousands displaced. Monsoon rains triggered flash floods and landslides, causing widespread destruction. Rescue efforts have saved over 3,000 people as teams work to clear highways and restore access. Domestic flights have resumed following significant weather-related disruptions.
summary: Floods in Nepal's capital have left at least 170 dead and thousands displaced. Monsoon rains triggered flash floods and landslides, causing widespread destruction. Rescue efforts have saved over 3,000 people as teams work to clear highways and restore access. Domestic flights have resumed following significant weather-related disruptions.

title: 'Neither has earned my vote': Larry Hogan slams Trump and Harris ahead of US presidential elections
content: Former Maryland governor Larry Hogan stated he will not vote for Donald Trump or Kamala Harris in the upcoming US presidential election. Running for a Senate seat, Hogan criticized both parties for deviating from their core values and expressed concerns over divisive politics. He also reiterated his past opposition to Trump despite receiving his endorsement.
summary: Former Maryland governor Larry Hogan stated he will not vote for Donald Trump or Kamala Harris in the upcoming US presidential election. Running for a Senate seat, Hogan criticized both parties for deviating from their core values and expressed concerns over divisive politics. He also reiterated his past opposition to Trump despite receiving his endorsement.
